Estop.definition: to impede or bar by estoppel
Estop.origin: [Anglo-French estop(p)er , literally, to stop up, from Middle French estouper , ultimately from Latin stuppa hemp fiber (used for plugging holes)]

es·top·ping.definition: [Anglo-French, literally, to stop up, from Middle French, ultimately from Latinhemp fiber (used for plugging holes)]to impede or bar by estoppel
